Electric power: Electric vehicles can be used as a replacement for traditional gasoline-powered vehicles. These vehicles can be charged from an external power source, such as a charging station.
Hydrogen fuel cells: Hydrogen fuel cells can be used to power vehicles by converting hydrogen gas into electricity. This would require the use of hydrogen fueling stations to refuel the vehicles.
Nuclear power: Nuclear power plants can be used to generate electricity for powering vehicles. This would require the use of nuclear fuel to generate the electricity.
Wind power: Wind turbines can be installed on vehicles to generate electricity for powering the vehicle. This would require the use of large batteries to store the energy generated during the day.
Geothermal power: Geothermal power can be used to generate electricity for powering vehicles. This would require the use of geothermal power plants to generate the electricity.
